options.name: --summary
options.description: The summary or brief description of an issue or task in Jira. It is typically a short sentence or phrase that gives an idea of what the issue is about.

options.name: --description
options.description: The detailed description of an issue or task in Jira. It provides more information than the summary and is typically used to describe the problem or request in more detail.

options.name: --epic-ticket
options.description: The epic ticket or issue in Jira. An epic is a large body of work that can be broken down into smaller tasks or issues. The epic ticket is used to track the progress of the entire epic.

options.name: --team-id
options.description: The team ID in Jira. The team ID is used to identify a specific team in Jira, which can be useful for assigning tasks or issues to specific teams.

options.name: --assignee-name
options.description: The name of the person who is assigned to work on a task or issue in Jira. The assignee is responsible for completing the work and is typically notified when the task or issue is assigned to them.

options.name: --priority-name
options.description: The priority level of a task or issue in Jira. Priority levels can range from low to critical and are used to indicate the importance of the issue or task.

options.name: --labels
options.description: The labels associated with a task or issue in Jira. Labels are used to categorize and organize issues and can be used to search for specific issues based on certain criteria.

options.name: --issue-type
options.description: The type of issue or task in Jira. Issue types can include things like bug, task, story, or epic, and are used to categorize and organize issues.

options.name: --component-name
options.description: The components associated with a task or issue in Jira. Components are used to categorize issues based on their functionality or location within a system.

options.name: --version-name
options.description: The version of software associated with a task or issue in Jira.

options.name: --project-id
options.description: The project in Jira. Projects are used to organize issues and tasks based on their purpose or area of focus.

options.name: --comment
options.description: The comments associated with a task or issue in Jira. Comments can be used to provide additional information or context about an issue, or to communicate with other team members.

options.name: --file-path
options.description: The file attachments associated with a task or issue in Jira. Files can be attached to provide additional information or to share documents or other resources with team members.

options.name: --jira-token
options.description: The Jira API token. The API token is used to authenticate API requests and provides a secure way to access Jira data.

options.name: --jira-url
options.description: The base URL of the Jira instance. The base URL is used to access Jira.

options.name: --description-objective
options.description: The objective of ticket

options.name: --description-assumptions
options.description: The assumptions of ticket. It's a array pass with ',' e.g: ('-da "My assumption" -da" My assumption two" -da" My tree ")

options.name: --description-pre-dep
options.description: The prerequisites and dependecies of ticket. It's a array pass with ',' e.g: ('-dpd "My requisite" -dpd" My requisite two" -dpd" My tree ")

options.name: --description-deliverables
options.description: The deliverables of ticket. It's a array pass with ',' e.g: ('-dd "My deliverable" -dd" My deliverable two" -dd" My tree ")

options.name: --description-acceptance-criteria
options.description: The acceptance criteria of ticket. It's a array pass with ',' e.g: ('-dac "My acceptance" -dac"My acceptance two" -dac" My tree ")

options.name: --description-additional-informations
options.description: The additional informations of ticket. It's a array pass with ',' e.g: ('-dai "My dditional informations" -dai "My dditional informations two " -dai" My tree ")
